alert.note: Alert for Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 3:23PM EST until January 12 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... Pompton River At Pompton Plains affecting Morris and Passaic Counties. For the Pompton River...including Pompton Plains...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pompton River at Pompton Plains. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The first flooding begins in the area of River Road and Harrison Street. At 16.0 feet, Residences on Pequannock Avenue along the river between Madison and Shady streets become surrounded by water. Businesses along Route 23 north begin to flood. At 17.0 feet, Pequannock Avenue at Roosevelt Street becomes impassable. Route 23 exit ramp at Alexander Avenue becomes impassable. At 18.0 feet, Pequannock Avenue at Shady Street becomes impassable and blocks Roosevelt and Shady Streets. Oakwood at Shady Street becomes impassable. The first evacuations begin. Flooding occurs on West View Road and the Lower Riverview community areas of Wayne. At 18.5 feet, Route 23, North and South, is impassable and closed. At 19.0 feet, Widespread flooding occurs in low lying areas of Wayne, Pequannock and Pompton Lakes. At 20.0 feet, Village section of Pompton Plains begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 19.5 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.6 feet on 04/10/1980. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Pompton River Pompton Plains 16.0 9.6 Tue 2 pm 17.6 18.7 19.5 1am 1/11 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 330 AM EST.
